column4: Pelo       i guess that i will just play all my vidoe's using Windows XP Pro, there are no restrictions there
it is illegal to decrypt them without purchasing a license; that is the reason you cannot play them out of the box in license
what are you using to play the dvds?
nothing right now because im trying to figure what to put in the command line in the removable media tab
i believe the default setting (totem %m) will work fine, you can also use mplayer or vlc (or somethingelse) if you prefer one of those applicatoins
thank you i will see if that works
it opens the player but all there is is just a blank screen
if you do, if you try to play the dvd from the command line in mplayer it will print out a bunch of text to the terminal that would indicated any problems
it is just a blank screen meaning it just hangs
i think you just run mplayer dvd:// or something like that (i don't actually have a dvd player so i'm not positive)
do it from the console so you can see the text that it prints out
as i said before, mplayer dvd://
do you know if fedora core 4 or 5 will play DVD's
it should be basically the same with them (install libdvdcss or whatever it is called, and then it just works)
